004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.pidwrappers;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.AnalogInput;
008import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.AnalogPotentiometer;
009import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.PIDSource;
010import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.PIDSourceType;
011
012/** Wrapper so that PIDSource is implemented for AnalogPotentiometer for old PIDController. */
013public class PIDAnalogPotentiometer extends AnalogPotentiometer implements PIDSource {
014  protected PIDSourceType m_pidSource = PIDSourceType.kDisplacement;
015
016  public PIDAnalogPotentiometer(int channel, double fullRange, double offset) {
017    super(channel, fullRange, offset);
018  }
019
020  public PIDAnalogPotentiometer(AnalogInput input, double fullRange, double offset) {
021    super(input, fullRange, offset);
022  }
023
024  public PIDAnalogPotentiometer(int channel, double scale) {
025    super(channel, scale);
026  }
027
028  public PIDAnalogPotentiometer(AnalogInput input, double scale) {
029    super(input, scale);
030  }
031
032  public PIDAnalogPotentiometer(int channel) {
033    super(channel);
034  }
035
036  public PIDAnalogPotentiometer(AnalogInput input) {
037    super(input);
038  }
039
040  @Override
041  public void setPIDSourceType(PIDSourceType pidSource) {
042    if (!pidSource.equals(PIDSourceType.kDisplacement)) {
043      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Only displacement PID is allowed for potentiometers.");
044    }
045    m_pidSource = pidSource;
046  }
047
048  @Override
049  public PIDSourceType getPIDSourceType() {
050    return m_pidSource;
051  }
052
053  /**
054   * Implement the PIDSource interface.
055   *
056   * @return The current reading.
057   */
058  @Override
059  public double pidGet() {
060    return get();
061  }
062}
